facts.text: Appeal by special leave from the order dated October 17, 1964, of the Government of India, Ministry of Steel and Mines.

anchor.surface_text: Appeal by special leave from the order dated October 17, 1964, of the Government of India, Ministry of Steel and Mines, Department of Mines and Metals on an application under Rule 54 of the Mineral Concession Rules 1960.

facts.text: Appellant is Madhya Pradesh Industries Ltd., a public limited company engaged in mining manganese ore.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant, the Madhya Pradesh Industries Ltd., is a public limited companypany engaged in mining manganese ore.

facts.text: On February 5, 1941, Rai Bahadur Bansilal Abirchand took a lease of 216 acres and 92 cents land in Government Forest, East Pench Range, Tahsil Ramtek, District Nagpur, from Governor of Central Provinces and Berar for 15 years commencing September 10, 1940.

anchor.surface_text: On February 5, 1941, one Rai Bahadur Bansilal Abirchand took a lease of a land of extent 216 acres and 92 cents in the Government Forest, East Pench Range, in the Tahsil of Ramtek in the District of Nagpur, from the Governor of Central Provinces and Berar for a term of 15 years companymencing from September 10, 1940.

facts.text: Under indenture dated March 4, 1952, appellant obtained transfer of the leasehold interest from successors of Bansilal Abirchand.

anchor.surface_text: Under an indenture dated March 4, 1952, the appellant obtained a transfer of the said leasehold interest from the successors in interest of the said Bansilal Abirchand.

facts.text: After transfer, appellant entered possession and spent about Rs. 10,00,000 developing the area for mining.

anchor.surface_text: After the transfer, the appellant entered into possession of the said extent of land and is alleged to have spent about Rs. 10,00,000 for the purpose of developing the area to carry out the mining operation.

facts.text: Lease to expire on September 9, 1955.

anchor.surface_text: The said lease was to expire on September 9, 1955.

facts.text: Appellant applied for renewal of lease for 20 years to Secretary to Government, Commerce and Industries Department, Madhya Pradesh.

anchor.surface_text: On the expiry of the said lease the appellant applied for the renewal of the lease for a further period of 20 years to the appropriate authority, namely, the Secretary to Government, Commerce and Industries Department, Madhya Pradesh, Nagpur.

facts.text: By letter dated September 2, 1958, offer on special duty informed appellant that renewal could not be granted.

anchor.surface_text: After a protracted companyrespondence companyering a period of about 3 years, the offer on special duty, Industries and Co-operation Department, State of Bombay, informed the appellant by letter dated September 2, 1958, that the said renewal companyld number be granted.

facts.text: Appellant filed revision to Central Government, dismissed on December 14, 1958.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant filed a revision against that order to the Central Government, but that was dismissed on December 14, 1958.

facts.text: On April 9, 1959, State of Bombay issued notification calling for applications for lease of the mines.

anchor.surface_text: On April 9, 1959, the State of Bombay issued a numberification calling for applications from the public in respect of the least of the said mines.

facts.text: On May 15, 1959, appellant filed application for grant of 20 years lease.

anchor.surface_text: On May 15, 1959, the appellant filed an application for the grant of a lease for a period of 20 years in respect of the said mines.

facts.text: On July 8, 1959, Government of Bombay granted entire area to appellant, informed by letter July 14, 1959.

anchor.surface_text: On July 8, 1959, the Government of Bombay made an order -ranting the entire area of the said mines to the appellant and by letter dated July 14, 1959, informed him of the same.

facts.text: During 1960, State of Bombay divided into Maharashtra and Gujarat, mines fell in Maharashtra.

anchor.surface_text: During the year 1960 the territories forming part of the State of Bombay were divided and the State of Maharashtra and the State of Gujarat came into being and the said mines fell in the Maharashtra State.

facts.text: On August 25, 1960, Maharashtra Government issued notification reserving mines for public sector exploitation.

anchor.surface_text: On August 25, 1960, the Maharashtra Government issued a numberification for the information of the public that the said mines were reserved for the exploitation of minerals in the public sector.

facts.text: On January 16, 1961, Collector of Nagpur informed appellant that application rejected as mines reserved for State exploitation.

anchor.surface_text: Thereafter on January 16, 1961, the Collector of Nagpur informed the appellant that its application for the ,ease of the mines was rejected as the mines in question fell in a block reserved for State exploitation.

facts.text: On March 11, 1961, appellant filed revision to Central Government.

anchor.surface_text: On March 11, 1961, the appellant filed a revision to the Central Government against the said order.

facts.text: On June 22, 1961, Central Government informed appellant to pursue reconsideration with Maharashtra Government.

anchor.surface_text: On June 22, 1961, the Central Government informed the appellant that instructions had been issued to the Government of Maharashtra... for reconsidering its application...

facts.text: By letter dated December 19, 1961, Government of Maharashtra rejected appellant's application for mining lease.

anchor.surface_text: By letter dated December 19, 1961, the Government of Maharashtra informed the appellant that its application for the mining lease had been rejected.

facts.text: On or about February 17, 1962, appellant filed revision application to Central Government against Maharashtra order.

anchor.surface_text: Thereafter, the appellant on or about February 17, 1962, filed a revision application before the Central Government against the said order of the Government of Maharashtra.

facts.text: On October 17, 1964, Central Government rejected the revision application.

anchor.surface_text: On October 17, 1964, the Central Government rejected the revision application.

facts.text: Government of Maharashtra issued notification dated March 26, 1965, inviting applications for mineral concessions in the area, with consent of Central Government.

anchor.surface_text: It is stated in the companynter-affidavit filed by the Central Government that subsequently the Government of Maharashtra, after obtaining the companysent of the Central Government, had issued a numberification dated March 26, 1965, inviting applications from the public for the grant of mineral companycessions in the said area.

facts.text: Appellant submitted application for mining lease in response to March 26, 1965 notification. This is not disputed.

anchor.surface_text: It is also stated therein that the appellant has submitted its application for the -rant of mining lease in respect of the said area in response to the said numberification. This is number disputed.

facts.text: Appeal filed against Central Government order dated October 17, 1964. Respondents: Central Government (1st), Under Secretary (2nd), State of Maharashtra (3rd).

anchor.surface_text: The appellant filed the present appeal against the order of the Central Government dated October 17, 1964... To that appeal, the Central Government is made the first respondent the Under Secretary... the second respondent-, and the State of Maharashtra, the third respondent.

facts.text: By order dated December 19, 1961, State Government of Maharashtra rejected appellant's application for mining lease for reasons mentioned.

anchor.surface_text: By its order dated December 19, 1961, the State Government of Maharashtra rejected the appellants application for a mining lease for the reasons mentioned in the order.

facts.text: Central Government order dated October 17, 1964 rejected revision after careful consideration, stating no valid ground for interfering with Maharashtra decision.

anchor.surface_text: By its order dated October 17, 1964, the Central Government rejected the revision application stating I am directed to refer to your application No. A 32/8163 dated 17-2-1962... Your application for revision is, therefore, rejected.

under Art. 136 of the Constitution inasmuch as the Maharashtra Government has not called for fresh applications for the granting of licence in respect of the said mines and the appellant, along with others. has put in its application to the said Government.
